question: Let the bolt in Figure P10.23 be made from cold-drawn steel. The bolt and the clamped plates are of the same length. Assume that the threads stop immediately above the nut.The clamped steel plates have a stiffness kc six times the bolt stiffness kb. The load fluctuates continuously between 0 and 8000 lb.(a) Find the minimum required value of initial preload to prevent loss of compression of the plates.(b) Find the minimum force in the plates for the fluctuating load when the preload is 8500 lb.<image 1>
description:
The image depicts a mechanical setup involving a bolt and two clamped plates. The bolt is shown with a nut at one end, and the clamped plates are positioned on either side of the bolt. The diagram includes the following annotations:

- \( F_a \): This represents an applied force acting on the bolt.
- \( k_b \): This denotes the stiffness of the bolt.
- \( k_c = 6k_b \): This indicates that the stiffness of the clamped plates (\( k_c \)) is six times the stiffness of the bolt (\( k_b \)).
- \( F_a = 0 \) to \( 8,000 \) lb: This specifies that the applied force \( F_a \) fluctuates between 0 and 8,000 pounds.

The diagram also shows the forces acting on the bolt and the clamped plates, indicating the interaction between the applied force and the resulting compression or tension in the system.
